alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Mills (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 05 at 7:57PM CDT until May 05 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Texas, including the following counties, Hamilton and Mills. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Goldthwaite, Evant, Mullin, Pecan Wells, Caradan, Center City, Indian Gap, Star, Pottsville, Shive and Bozar.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
